product_overview: Zip Food is a unified delivery platform connecting customers, restaurants, and delivery drivers within a single cohesive web application. It offers tailored user experiences for each actor, enabling seamless order creation, management, and fulfillment across multiple user profiles.
core_goals: Provide an integrated platform where customers, restaurants, and delivery drivers interact efficiently.
Deliver a user-friendly frontend interface with complete functional representation for all three user types.
Enable real-time order tracking and status updates visible to all stakeholders in the order lifecycle.
Implement a robust multi-actor authentication system for secure access and session persistence.
Support multilingual interfaces with proper internationalization including Portuguese, English, Spanish, and Hebrew languages with RTL layout support.
Ensure a responsive and accessible design adaptable to different user profiles and device types.
key_features: Multi-Actor Authentication System enabling registration, login, logout, and session management for customers, restaurants, and delivery drivers.
Customer Interface offering restaurant browsing, menu viewing, order placement, order history, and profile management.
Restaurant Management Interface providing menu management, order reception, status updates, and profile/configuration management.
Delivery Driver Interface featuring dashboards for order management, availability status, earnings tracking, and delivery area management.
Internationalization system supporting multiple languages with RTL layout adjustments for Hebrew.
Global header and navigation system with responsive design, language selector, and adaptive navigation for each user type.
State management powered by Zustand for handling authentication and global application state.
Real-time notification system including alerts, toasts, and notification center.
Connectivity management detecting online/offline status and offline mode handling.
Reusable UI component library with animation, consistency, and responsiveness.
Comprehensive order management with status tracking and history accessible to all actors.
Utilities and helpers for validation, constants, and shared functionality.
Development tools for debugging, testing, and translation management.
Complete automated test suite ensuring quality of authentication, internationalization, and critical functionalities.
user_flow_summary: Customer registers or logs in, browses restaurants, selects items, customizes and places order.
Restaurant receives order notification, confirms it, updates status through preparation to ready for pickup.
System dispatches order to nearby available delivery drivers.
Delivery driver receives notifications for nearby orders, accepts delivery request, picks up order and delivers to customer.
Order status updates propagate to all users, ending with delivery completion confirmation.
validation_criteria: All user types (customer, restaurant, delivery driver) must be able to register, log in, and maintain session state securely.
Order lifecycle status updates must be accurately reflected in real-time to all participants.
Internationalization must fully support Portuguese, English, Spanish, and Hebrew with correct translations and RTL layout adjustment.
Frontend UI must be fully interactive, visually complete, and consistent with mock data across all user interfaces.
Notification system must deliver timely and appropriate alerts for orders and system events.
Application must detect connectivity status and handle offline/online transitions gracefully.
Core user flows such as order placement, order management, and delivery acceptance must be thoroughly tested and bug-free.
Automated test suite coverage must be comprehensive, including authentication and internationalization scenarios.
